page.title: 02ST. ANNE'S CHURCH, KEW GREEN
page.content:
St. Anne's Church was built in 1714, and stands in one corner of Kew Green on land presented by{Queen Anne,}who also gave{Â£100}towards the building cost. This came to a total of{Â£500, being less than the cost of the weekly upkeep today. The land was originally marshland surrounded by fields, and before the church was built people worshipped in a chapel in the fields.
Some 250 people attend St. Anne's on a regular basis, representing under 3% of the population of Kew. There are three Sunday services, the main one being held at 10 a.m. Several services are held during the week. On Sundays, services are quite well attended, but the weekday congregation tends to be very small. Large numbers do attend the Christmas and Easter services, often as many as 600.
